skillTree.localised_description: The dread steeds of Chaos are more than mere horses, but creatures tainted by Daemon blood, said to be gifts from the Dark Gods themselves.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

A unit with the Mark of Nurgle has:
	➕  Poison Contact Effect
	➕ Increased  Hit Points
	➕ Increased  Melee Defence
	➖ Reduced  Melee Attack

skillTree.localised_description: A vast, mobile altar allows the souls of the slain to be ritualistically condemned directly from the field of slaughter.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

A unit with the Mark of Nurgle has:
	➕  Poison Contact Effect
	➕ Increased  Hit Points
	➕ Increased  Melee Defence
	➖ Reduced  Melee Attack

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with each nearby entity death.

skillTree.localised_description: This vile, mutilated steed bears its rider into the very thick of battle, where any wounds scored upon its cancerous flesh are sealed by the pus weeping from its foetid body.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

A unit with the Mark of Nurgle has:
	➕  Poison Contact Effect
	➕ Increased  Hit Points
	➕ Increased  Melee Defence
	➖ Reduced  Melee Attack

skillTree.localised_description: The Warriors of Chaos are the playthings of Gods and given many gifts, including formidable fighting skills.
The shadow of the Ruinous Powers looms large, protecting those who bear their mark.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: When normally killed in action, this Hero will be wounded instead

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: "Robes? Fool! We're going to battle, not a ball. Hand me my armour! ARMOUR!"
Spell after spell, grant the enemy no reprieve!
Magic is little threat to one so well-versed in its dark and terrible intricacies.
You cannot escape death indefinitely… Well, you can, but not without a College education, generally speaking. Most will eventually feel infirmity's firm cruel grip, one way or another.
Best not touch, lest something – everything – comes off in your hand.
There’s little you can do to get under the skin of one who has rubbed shoulders with the diseased for so long.

related_attributes.bullet_text: Entities with this attribute ignore the effects of enemy contact effects such as  Poison

skillTree.localised_description: Spellcasters can oft-sense when magic is close or being drawn from the Winds.

effects.description: Scouting action: Magic item drop chance is increased by an additional 5%
Scouting action: Magic item drop chance is increased by an additional 10%
Scouting action: Magic item drop chance is increased by an additional 15%

skillTree.localised_description: The locals take notice and will be inspired or frightened into action.

effects.description: Spread Corruption action: Nurgle corruption is increased by an additional 1
Spread Corruption action: Nurgle corruption is increased by an additional 2
Spread Corruption action: Nurgle corruption is increased by an additional 3

skillTree.localised_description: Oft-times, though you may have much, what you want the most is what your rivals have; such envy focuses the mind and creativity.

effects.description: Steal Technology action: Research rate is increased by an additional 3%
Steal Technology action: Research rate is increased by an additional 6%
Steal Technology action: Research rate is increased by an additional 10%

skillTree.localised_description: Such a champion will not bend or break, but slay in their Lord's name.

effects.description: Wound action: Additional 5% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 12% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 21% chance of wounding target

skillTree.localised_description: To sow discord and confuse the enemy, sending them down the wrong route or befuddling their senses.

effects.description: Block Army action: Movement range is modified by an additional -3%
Block Army action: Movement range is modified by an additional -8%
Block Army action: Movement range is modified by an additional -15%

skillTree.localised_description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

A unit with the Mark of Nurgle has:
	➕  Poison Contact Effect
	➕ Increased  Hit Points
	➕ Increased  Melee Defence
	➖ Reduced  Melee Attack

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Oh, horrific wonder! Vile awe! Such hateful majesty!

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with each kill made by the unit.
Effect intensity increases with each kill made by the unit.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +10% for units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The champion is surrounded by crackling flames that burn his enemies whilst leaving his own body untouched.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent engaged in melee.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: A Chaos Familiar memorises spells on its master's behalf, constantly rehearsing for its big moment until it is called upon to share its arcane knowledge.
Fatigue is no issue when one is driven by the darkest rage imaginable.
Those blessed by Chaos see not only what is before them, but also what lurks in shadow, hiding in the periphery.
The champion has been rewarded with a hideous appearance, grotesque enough to wither the hearts of men.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Granted skin as strong as iron plate, there is little that can penetrate the champion's defences.
The champion's skin is covered with a thousand reptilian scales, each as tough as Dragonhide.
Some are blessed by a dark understanding, able to gleam knowledge from every experience.
